title.value: One-shot Learning for MIPs with SOS1 Constraints
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: One-shot Learning for MIPs with SOS1 Constraints

extractions.description: This paper proposes a one-shot learning heuristic for mixed-integer programming (MIP) problems with special ordered sets of type 1 (SOS1). The method leverages solutions discovered within the branch-and-bound tree to construct a model with minimal overhead, aiming for high-quality solutions for recurring issues. It is evaluated on the locomotive assignment problem (LAP) and sets of MIPLIB instances that include SOS1 constraints and is shown to be effective when compared to state-of-the-art solvers like CPLEX, Gurobi, and SCIP.

type.justification: The paper includes evaluations and experimental results, indicating an empirical study.
type.quote: We evaluate our method on the locomotive assignment problem (LAP) and sets of MIPLIB instances...Experimental results include a comparison with multiple primal heuristics and state-of-the-art MIP solvers.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on leveraging machine learning techniques within mixed-integer programming solvers.
name.quote: Keywords: Machine Learning, Mixed-integer programming, Learning Heuristics, Fleet Management Problem, MIPLIB.

name.justification: The paper proposes a heuristic for MIPs with SOS1 constraints, indicating a focus on this subfield.
name.quote: This paper proposes a primal heuristic for MIPs with special ordered sets of type 1 (SOS1).

name.justification: The application domain of fleet management and optimization problems places the paper in this subfield.
name.quote: The intersection of mixed-integer programming (MIP) and machine learning (ML) presents a unique opportunity to advance the frontiers of optimization.

name.justification: The paper introduces the PNF heuristic to find solutions for MIPs with SOS1 constraints.
name.quote: This paper proposes a primal heuristic for MIPs with special ordered sets of type 1 (SOS1) that we refer to as Probe and Freeze (PNF).

is_contributed.justification: The PNF heuristic is a new approach introduced by the authors.
is_contributed.quote: This paper proposes a primal heuristic for MIPs with special ordered sets of type 1 (SOS1) that we refer to as Probe and Freeze (PNF).

is_executed.justification: The experimental results and comparisons with solvers imply that the PNF heuristic has been executed.
is_executed.quote: We evaluate our method on the locomotive assignment problem (LAP) and sets of MIPLIB instances.

is_compared.justification: The PNF heuristic is compared with multiple primal heuristics and state-of-the-art MIP solvers.
is_compared.quote: Experimental results include a comparison with multiple primal heuristics and state-of-the-art MIP solvers.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no reference to a specific external paper on the PNF method as it is an original contribution.

name.justification: The paper mentions using sets of MIPLIB instances for evaluation.
name.quote: ...and sets of MIPLIB instances that contain constraints based on special ordered sets of type 1.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific paper is referenced for the MIPLIB dataset within the document.

name.justification: The paper uses historical data from the Canadian National Railway Company for the locomotive assignment problem (LAP).
name.quote: The LAP instances are generated using historical data from CN.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific external paper is mentioned in relation to this dataset.

name.justification: CPLEX is mentioned as one of the solvers used for comparison in the experiments.
name.quote: For each instance, we compare the performance of PNF with different primal heuristics and state-of-the-art MIP solvers: CPLEX [27], Gurobi [21] and SCIP [10].

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific paper title is referenced for the CPLEX library as it is a widely recognized tool.

name.justification: Gurobi is used as one of the comparison solvers in the study's empirical evaluations.
name.quote: For each instance, we compare the performance of PNF with different primal heuristics and state-of-the-art MIP solvers: CPLEX [27], Gurobi [21] and SCIP [10].

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific paper title is referenced for the Gurobi library within the document.

name.justification: SCIP is one of the solvers employed for comparison against the proposed heuristic.
name.quote: For each instance, we compare the performance of PNF with different primal heuristics and state-of-the-art MIP solvers: CPLEX [27], Gurobi [21] and SCIP [10].

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific paper is mentioned for SCIP within the paper. It is used as a benchmark solver.
